Patient reports chest discomfort started this morning. 58 year old woman with diabetes and high cholesterol. Her blood pressure today is 144/88 with heart rate of 94. Temperature is normal at 98.4 and she's breathing at 18 breaths per minute with oxygen saturation 97% on room air.

On examination, she appears mildly uncomfortable. Cardiovascular exam shows regular rhythm, no murmurs appreciated. Respiratory exam reveals clear lung fields bilaterally.

This is likely angina given her risk factors. ECG shows no acute ST changes but has T wave flattening in lateral leads. Troponin is pending.

Will start aspirin, obtain serial cardiac enzymes, cardiology consultation requested. Patient to remain NPO pending further evaluation.
